intro: Pimpinella kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Pimpinella kurdica is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
